news.summary: We recently published a list of Top 10 Stocks on Jim Cramer’s Radar as Trump Tariffs Wreak Havoc Across Global Markets. If any winners emerge from the trade war started by the Trump administration, the aviation industry certainly isn’t going to be among them.  Shares in aerospace manufacturers such as Boeing, Airbus, GE Aerospace and Rolls-Royce plummeted Thursday as a result of Trump's “Liberation Day” announcements.  Airbus’s plant in Alabama would face a cost surge, but so would Boeing’s many U.S. assembly lines.

Shares of the companies spun off from the former industrial icon General Electric were all tanking Friday, led by medical device maker GE HealthCare, on investor fears that they would be hurt by Beijing’s retaliatory levies countering President Donald Trump’s tariffs.
